wikipedia_page.main: Samuel William Jarman (birth registered first ¼ 1887 – 15 August 1916) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1900s and 1910s. He played at representative level for Great Britain, and at club level for Leeds (Heritage № 225), as a fullback, or forward (prior to the specialist positions of; prop, hooker, second-row, loose forward), i.e. number 1, or, 8 to 13, during the era of contested scrums.
